block.p: Charles Cullen, a 43-year-old nurse, was charged last week with the murder of one patient and the attempted murder of another at the hospital where he worked, Somerset Medical Center in Somerville, and has apparently told investigators he killed as many as 40 more people in his 16-year nursing career.
Mr. Cullen was arrested on Dec. 12 and, at a Superior Court hearing last Monday, said he would not contest the murder charges. He is being held in lieu of $1 million bail.

Charles Cullen, a 43-year-old nurse, was charged last week with the murder of one patient and the attempted murder of another at the hospital where he worked, Somerset Medical Center in Somerville, and has apparently told investigators he killed as many as 40 more people in his 16-year nursing career.
Mr. Cullen was arrested on Dec. 12 and, at a Superior Court hearing last Monday, said he would not contest the murder charges. He is being held in lieu of $1 million bail.

Officials say Mr. Cullen may have killed as many as 15 patients during his 13-month employment at Somerset Medical Center, apparently giving sick patients lethal doses of drugs to end their pain and suffering. Investigators said this may have been a pattern at other hospitals and nursing homes in which he worked in New Jersey and Pennsylvania - possibly as many as 10 places of employment - and are investigating suspicious deaths at those places.
